    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        Display all books in the list.

      • getBook

        public Book getBook(int pos)
        Returns a reference to the book at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - position of element to be returned
        Returns:
        reference to the Book object at specified position; null if not a valid position

      • insertBook

        public boolean insertBook(java.lang.String bookString)
        Insert a new Book into the list given a book string.
        Parameters:
        bookString - book information having this form: isbn|title|author|numPages|year
        Returns:
        true if insert was successful; false otherwise

        If there are already 10000 books in the list we ignore the request to add a new book. Lazy? Yes!

      • insertBook

        public boolean insertBook(java.lang.String isbn,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String author,
                 int numPages,
                 int year)
        Insert a new Book into the list given individually specified * parameters.
        Parameters:
        isbn - the ISBN of the new book
        title - the title of the new book
        author - the author of the new book
        numPages - the number of pages in the new book
        year - the year of publication of the new book
        Returns:
        true if insert was successful; false otherwise

        If there are already 10000 books in the list we ignore the request to add a new book. Lazy? Yes!

      • removeBook

        public boolean removeBook(int pos)
        Remove the book found at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position at which the book is found
        Returns:
        true if delete was successful; false otherwise

        NOTE: We operate under the assumption that this is an unordered list of Books. Also, if the position specified is not within the range of existing books we ignore the request.

      • saveState

        public void saveState()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Save current in-memory version of the database back to disk.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • searchByAuthor

        public void searchByAuthor(SearchRequest sr)
        Searches list on Author field and returns (via the parameter) the position at which the entry was found.
        Parameters:
        sr - a SearchRequest object that specifies where to start and end the search as well as what value is to be searched for

        The foundPos field of the SearchRequest parameter will be -1 if the search fails. Otherwise it will be set to the position in the array at which the element was found. This position value can be passed to the getBook method to obtain a reference to the book that matched.

        This search is case-sensitive but allows for a partial match. Finding later matches can be accomplished by calling the method again with the startPos field of the SearchRequest object set to the position following the previous match.

      • searchByISBN

        public void searchByISBN(SearchRequest sr)
        Searches list on ISBN field and returns (via the parameter) the position at which the entry was found.
        Parameters:
        sr - a SearchRequest object that specifies where to start and end the search as well as what value is to be searched for

        The foundPos field of the SearchRequest parameter will be -1 if the search fails. Otherwise it will be set to the position in the array at which the element was found. This position value can be passed to the getBook method to obtain a reference to the book that matched.

        This search is case-sensitive but allows for a partial match. Finding later matches can be accomplished by calling the method again with the startPos field of the SearchRequest object set to the position following the previous match.

      • searchByNumPages

        public void searchByNumPages(SearchRequest sr)
        Searches list on NumPages field and returns (via the parameter) the position at which the entry was found.
        Parameters:
        sr - a SearchRequest object that specifies where to start and end the search as well as what value is to be searched for

        The foundPos field of the SearchRequest parameter will be -1 if the search fails. Otherwise it will be set to the position in the array at which the element was found. This position value can be passed to the getBook method to obtain a reference to the book that matched.

        Since the search field is an int, this search converts the search value to an int prior to the search. Thus, it finds only exact matches.

      • searchByTitle

        public void searchByTitle(SearchRequest sr)
        Searches list on Title field and returns (via the parameter) the position at which the entry was found.
        Parameters:
        sr - a SearchRequest object that specifies where to start and end the search as well as what value is to be searched for

        The foundPos field of the SearchRequest parameter will be -1 if the search fails. Otherwise it will be set to the position in the array at which the element was found. This position value can be passed to the getBook method to obtain a reference to the book that matched.

        This search is case-sensitive but allows for a partial match. Finding later matches can be accomplished by calling the method again with the startPos field of the SearchRequest object set to the position following the previous match.

      • searchByYear

        public void searchByYear(SearchRequest sr)
        Searches list on Year field and returns (via the parameter) the position at which the entry was found.
        Parameters:
        sr - a SearchRequest object that specifies where to start and end the search as well as what value is to be searched for

        The foundPos field of the SearchRequest parameter will be -1 if the search fails. Otherwise it will be set to the position in the array at which the element was found. This position value can be passed to the getBook method to obtain a reference to the book that matched.

        Since the search field is an int, this search converts the search value to an int prior to the search. Thus, it finds only exact matches.
